respStmt.name: Muʿizz al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī
معز الدين محمد الحسيني
Sometimes referred to as Badr al-Din Hilali

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: This is an illuminated and illustrated Safavid copy of a mystic poem (masnavi) entitled Ṣifat al-ʿāshiqīn (Qualities of lovers) by Nūr al-Dīn Hilālī (d. 936 AH / 1529-30 CE). It was written in nastaʿlīq script by Muʿizz al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī in 978 AH / 1570-1 CE. The manuscript opens with a double-page illustrated frontispiece (fols. 1b-2a), followed by a double-page illuminated incipit (fols. 2b-3a). Borders throughout the codex are illuminated with floral and bird motifs. The lacquer binding is original to the manuscript.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Persian.

colophon.note: katabahu al-ʿabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh al-ghanī /1/ Muʿizz al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī ghafara Allāh dhunūbah wa-satara ʿuyūbahu fī /2/ fī sanat 978 /3/
In Arabic, giving the name of the scribe and the date of copying

layoutDesc.layout: Text written horizontally and obliquely; framing lines in blue, gold, red, and light blue

handDesc.handNote: Written in nastaʿlīq script in black with ploychrome chapter headings

decoDesc.decoNote: Six illustrations; double-page illustrated frontispiece (fols. 1b-2a); double-page illuminated incipit (fols. 2b-3a); illuminated border with floral and bird motifs; illuminated chapter/section headings; framing lines in blue, gold, red, and light blue

decoNote.title: Double-page illustrated frontispiece
decoNote.note: This is the right side of a double-page illustrated frontispiece depicting a festive gathering in a landscape with poets, chess players, and servants preparing food.

decoNote.title: Double-page illustrated frontispiece
decoNote.note: This is the left side of a double-page illustrated frontispiece depicting a festive gathering in a landscape with poets, chess players, and servants preparing food.

decoNote.title: A brave man with a sword killing a lion
Majnūn among animals in the wilderness
Sultan Maḥmūd and Ayāz in a landscape
A festive party with a hunter and his young friends
A love-struck beggar brings a ball to the king

binding.p: Lacquer (without flap); decorated with animals and floral motifs; doublures with dentelle-style decoration in gold and blue

history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters bequest

listBibl.head: Relevant Works
listBibl.bibl: Richard, Francis. Catalogue des manuscrits persans. (Paris: Bibliothèque nationale, 1989), nos. 351-2.
